meanings.definition: To give a wrong impression or idea.
meanings.sent1: She misgiven her friend by accidently telling a lie.
meanings.sent2: The magician misgiven the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent3: The misgiven message caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent4: His smile misgiven his true feelings of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The misleading sign misgiven the hikers, leading them off the trail.

meanings.definition: To have doubts or suspicions about something.
meanings.sent1: I misgiven the weather forecast and brought an umbrella just in case.
meanings.sent2: She misgiven his intentions when he offered to help.
meanings.sent3: The detective misgiven the alibi provided by the suspect.
meanings.sent4: His sudden change in behavior misgiven his friends.
meanings.sent5: The strange noise outside misgiven the cat, making it hide under the bed.
